definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: He took up lodgings at 4 Clarence Baths in Devonport.
sentences.chinese: 他在德文波特克拉伦斯澡堂4号住下。

sentences.english: He said that he has not yet to take off pants, the goods have been into the to clean the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 他说那天他还未脱去裤子，阿财已入来清洁澡堂。

sentences.english: I will leave It In the prisoners' showers. Now go, and reveal nothing of this.
sentences.chinese: 我会把它留在囚犯澡堂，现在滚吧，别泄漏出去。

sentences.english: A bath house is where people shower, which is why they're naked.
sentences.chinese: 澡堂是人们洗淋浴的地方，所以他们都是光著身子的。

sentences.english: Then, I went to the nearest bathhouse with my father.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我去了附近的澡堂与我的父亲。

sentences.english: Beijing bathhouses have all but disappeared. Will the few survivors escape the bulldozer?
sentences.chinese: 北京的澡堂子正在消失，能有几家逃脱强拆者的铲平？

sentences.english: TS: You're hot. Ever go to bathhouses or sex clubs?
sentences.chinese: 你太性感了，有没有去过澡堂或者性爱夜店。

sentences.english: How many gov. officials go to gay bathhouses in China?
sentences.chinese: 中国有多少政府官员到同性恋的澡堂？

sentences.english: It In the prisoners' showers. Now go, and reveal nothing of this.
sentences.chinese: 我会把它留在囚犯澡堂，现在滚吧，别泄漏出去。

sentences.english: The guest house condition is limited, on lying have a public bathhouse.
sentences.chinese: 招待所条件有限，只有一个公用的澡堂。

definition: communal bath/common pool in bath house
to bathe/to immerse oneself in a warm bath
